content: The man and woman were found in the village of  Kirk Ella on Monday morningPolice have launched a probe into two 'unexplained' deaths after the bodies of a man and woman were found in a village home.

The pair were discovered in a property Kirk Ella, on the outskirts of Kingston upon Hull, East Yorkshire.Officers were called to the property in Mill Lane on Monday at 11.26am following reports of a concern for safety.  Police made the gruesome discovery when they arrived at the home, trigging their investigation. Humberside Police said their deaths are currently being treated as unexplained. Neither people have been identified.

Humberside Fire and Rescue Service said they were called to assist the police and used a lock breaker to gain access to the home.Fire service crews used breathing apparatus and hazmat suits to see if any hazardous materials were present, reports Hull Daily Mail.Gas detection checks were also carried out, which were negative and there was natural ventilation in the property.In a statement to MailOnline, Humberside Police said: 'We were called to reports of a concern for safety at a property on Mill Lane in Kirk Ella at around 11.26am on Monday 1 May.'Upon arrival, a man and a woman were found to have died. The circumstances of their death are yet to be established and are currently being treated as unexplained.'
